 Class representing states at which the planner must determine the optimal action. More...
class  ValueState
 Base class for states that are reachable from some state given to policy(), which must have some value that can be backed up. More...

Detailed Description

Class that uses value iteration to output StatePolicy objects given an MDP.

Member Function Documentation

PlannerRef Planner::create ( const MDPRef &  mdp,
const StatePredicateRef &  terminal,
const StateFunctionRef &  goal,
double  gamma,
double  epsilon 
) [static]

Parameters:
mdp The Markov decision process for which to compute the optimal policy
terminal A function that specifies terminal states, where the policy may not determine the action taken. The value of this function may not change.
goal A function specifying the value of each terminal state. The value of this function may not change.
gamma The discount factor to use
epsilon This planner will not back up changes in value smaller than this threshold

For debugging purposes: do full sweeps over all state objects until convergence, skipping prioritization logic.

Planner::DecisionStateRef Planner::policy ( const MDPStateRef &  s,
ValueStateWeakRef *  ptr 
) [protected]

Parameters:
s The state at which the policy should be evaluated.
ptr If non-NULL, *ptr will be assigned the return value of any newly constructed DecisionState objects before initialization, to avoid unbounded recursions.

Definition at line 649 of file planner.cc.

References Planner::DecisionState::create(), m_nonterminals, and m_this.

ModelBasedStatePolicyRef Planner::policy ( const StateVectorRef &  s  ) 

Outputs (after possibly computing) the optimal policy for the MDP.

Parameters:
s The state at which to evaluate the optimal policy
Returns:
A object specifying the optimal child action, as well as giving access to the MDPState describing that state-action's behavior.

friend class DecisionState [friend]

Definition at line 328 of file planner.hh.

Member Data Documentation

__gnu_cxx::hash_map<StateVectorRef, ValueStateWeakRef, StateHasher> Planner::m_completions [private]

Each key is a basis state that appears in the value of successors() for some MDPStateAction object.

The data pointers are either DecisionState objects in m_nonterminals or ValueState objects representing terminal states.

Referenced by successor_value().

std::set<DecisionStateWeakRef> Planner::m_inbox [private]

The inbox includes all DecisionState objects that have not executed propagate_value_change since their observed MDPState object changed.

Definition at line 374 of file planner.hh.

const MDPRef Planner::m_mdp [private]

Definition at line 350 of file planner.hh.

Referenced by policy(), and successor_value().

NonterminalsContainer Planner::m_nonterminals [private]

Each key is the return value of the state() method for an MDPState.

Each datum is the DecisionState object constructed with that MDPState.

Definition at line 363 of file planner.hh.

Referenced by debug(), perform_standard_value_iteration(), policy(), write_policy(), and write_value_function().

std::map<DecisionStateWeakRef, TaskRef> Planner::m_outbox [private]

Keys: DecisionState objects that have changed their policy action.

Data: The original policy action before the first change. (The data can be used to avoid sending policy change notifications unnecessarily, when a DecisionState object switches back to its original policy action.)

Definition at line 381 of file planner.hh.

Referenced by propagate_changes().

std::vector<DecisionStateRef> Planner::m_pqueue [private]

This binary heap contains all the DecisionState objects created by this Planner that have (Bellman) error greater than epsilion.

This error is used to prioritize value backups, which eliminate this error.

Definition at line 387 of file planner.hh.

Referenced by debug_pqueue(), and propagate_changes().
